intro: Laportea liebmannii, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine, silky hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
